CSS_counter-styleFallback.summary: The fallback descriptor of the @counter-style at-rule can be used to specify a counter style to fall back to if the counter style being defined cannot create a marker representation for a particular counter value.

remarks.para:
-Other @counter-style descriptors: @counter-style/system, @counter-style/symbols, @counter-style/additive-symbols, @counter-style/negative, @counter-style/prefix, @counter-style/suffix, @counter-style/range, @counter-style/pad, and @counter-style/speak-as
-list-style, list-style-image, list-style-position
-symbols: the functional notation for creating anonymous counter styles

CSS_counter-styleFallback.value: The descriptor takes a single <counter-style-name> as its value:If omitted, the counter fallback defaults to decimal.
